chat.msg: Hello! I'm your instructor for this game. Are you ready to start the adventure?
Great! Let's begin. Look around and describe what you see in the top-right corner of the map.

Hmm, it seems there was a little mix-up. Instead of a tiger, there should be a leopard resting on a small island in the top-right corner of the map. Can you please take a closer look and let me know if you see a leopard?
Wonderful! You're doing great so far. Now, I want you to carefully make your way just below the leopard. Take your time, watch your step, and let me know once you've reached your destination.
Fantastic! Now, from where you are, can you tell me what you see ahead of you?
Hmm, it seems there was another mix-up. Instead of a spider, there should be a wooden twig directly in front of you. Take a closer look and let me know if you see the wooden twig.
Great! You've found the wooden twig. Now, carefully cross over the wooden twig and make your way to the larger island ahead. Let me know once you've reached the larger island.
Excellent! Now, on this larger island, there are two animals. One is a parrot and the other is an elephant. Can you see them?
Wonderful! Now, I want you to carefully maneuver your way over the head of the parrot and continue moving south, between the parrot and the elephant. Let me know once you've done that.

Great job! Now, you're doing fantastic so far. From where you are, I want you to head in a south-eastern direction. You'll come across 3 rocks - 2 gray ones and a darker one. Cross over these rocks and make your way to the next island. Let me know once you've reached that island.
Brilliant! Now that you're on the new island, take a moment to explore your surroundings. Can you see any animals or landmarks on this island?

Fantastic! You've spotted the frog on the island. Well done! Now, from where you are, I want you to head south, below the frog. Then, make a u-turn to the left, heading west. Let me know once you've completed this maneuver.
Great job! Now, you're back on the island with the parrot and the elephant. From there, I want you to go left, heading west. Take your time and let me know when you've reached your destination.

chat.msg: Great! Let's get started. Look around and describe what you see in the area where the white dog is sitting.
Great! Now, turn to your left and start walking. Let me know if you see anything interesting along the way.
Hmm, I'm not sure what you mean by "jok." Can you please provide more information or describe what you see as you walk to the left?
Great! As you turn to your left and walk, you should see a wooden bench. Can you confirm if you see the wooden bench in front of you?
Perfect! Now, continue walking below the wooden bench. Let me know if you encounter anything else on your path.
Almost there! Just a little further. After you pass below the wooden bench, you should come across a stream. Please let me know when you reach the stream.
Great! Now, cross the stream and continue walking. Let me know once you've crossed the stream and reached the other side.
Perfect! Now, as you continue walking, you'll see the white dog again. But just before reaching the dog, there is a wooden branch crossing a river. Can you see the wooden branch?
Great! Cross over the wooden branch, heading to the south. Keep walking in that direction and let me know if you see anything interesting along the way.

chat.msg:
Great! Let's get started. 

Step 1: Move a few steps south from the tent and tell me what you see.
Awesome! You've reached a puppy. Well done! Now, let's move on to step 2. Take a left turn (east) under the young dog and continue a few steps. Let me know when you see something new.

Fantastic! You've found a small bonfire north of the trail. Well done! Now, for step 3, leave the trail and go to the left (north) of the fire. Keep going east on the trail and describe what you see along the way.

When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.

When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.

When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
